review: Chrome is ok. Nothing to write home about. I guess for $35, it's hard to expect much. And you get exactly what you pay for. I don't like how it shows my entire browser window on the TV screen when I try to stream RedBull XCO video to the TV. I tried to use the settings to make it show only the video but it does not work. AppleTV or Roku with Plex Media Server is the better way to go.

review: I received this device on April 15 and set it up in 5 minutes. All you have to do is plug it into an outlet and into the HDMI input from your TV. You need a smart phone, tablet or a computer using Chrome as the internet browser, set up  by downloading the app and entering the WiFi password. Once set up, I was able to watch whatever was on my laptop. tablet or phone with a click of a button. This device makes watching whatever you want with a push of a button. I am able to watch MLB, Netflix, HBO Go, Vevo, Youtube, Amazon Prime, Hulu and more.
author: Don

review: I gave this to my husband as a gift after he mentioned it. He is TV watching, internet surfing fool to where we have 2 cable services in our house. He is soooooooo happy with this gadget. You can connect your internet browser from your phone or computer and watch it on tv. I had no idea this technology existed. You do need to have a fast internet service for this to work optimally so we upgraded our speed. This is an awesome buy!!
